result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jeremy A. Clark

defendant.name: Clark, Jeremy A.
defendant.address: 306 Sterling Avenue, Black River Falls, WI 54615

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Jeremy A. Clark in court with attorney Paul M Fredrickson.  Melissa S. Inlow appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  SPD Fredrickson states they have an agreement, plea G to Count 1, 15CF192 with remaining counts and 15CM305 DRI.  Probation and expungment requested.  This is a joint recommendation.  Proper notification to victims by the State.  Court reviews charges and penalties in 15CF192.  He understands.  Pleads guilty.  Judge reviews elements of the charge and guilty plea questionnaire/rights.  Defense stipulates to factual basis in complaint.  Court finds he FVKI enters his plea and waives his rights; factual basis exists.  Finds guilty of 15CF192, Ct 1 as repeater.  Defendant excercises his right to allocution.  Court accepts the joint recommendation, finds him guilty of Count 1 with remaining counts DRI; sentence is withheld and placed on probation for 3 years with conditions.  Court orders 15CM305 DRI.
ADA Melissa Inlow appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in person and with Attorney Fredrickson.  Set for plea/sentencing.
Plea/sentencing hearing on May 2, 2016 at 10:00 am.
Status conference on April 11, 2016 at 03:00 pm.

DA Gerald Fox appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared with Attorney Fredrickson.  Victim notification complied with.  Attorney Fredrickson said they don't have an agreement.  Schedule STC on  3/7/16 at 3 pm.  Bond continued.
This bond includes cases 15CM305 and 15CF192:  Not to write any checks or pocess any financial of anyone else. He is to reside with his grandparents unless he has permission by court to move
Defendant appeared by video from the Jackson County Jail.
ADA Melissa Inlow appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared by video from the Jackson County Jail.  Attorney Fredrickson appeared in court.  Bond modified.  Plea/sentencing set for 2/8/16 at 10 am.

ADA Melissa Inlow appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared by video from the Jackson County Jail.  Attorney Fredrickson appeared in court.   Attorney Fredrickson requested the bond be modified.  Court wants victims to contact the victim/witness coordinator before ruling.

Covers 15CM305 and 15CF192.  Until further order of the court, you shall have no contact, directly or indirectly, either personally, by mail, telephone or through any other person, except through your attorney, with any of the following individuals and/or businesses: J. C. and J. C.. Not to write any checks or poccess any financials of anyone else.  Provide address to clerk of courts w/in 24 hours of release.  AMENDED 1/4/16.  Phone or letter contact with the victims is allowed.

ADA Melissa Inlow appears for the State.  Defendant appeared by video from the Jackson County Jail.  Attorney Fredrickson appeared in court.  Attorney Fredrickson requesting bond be amended to allow phone or letter contact with the victims.  Applies to both cases.

ADA Melissa Inlow appears for the State.  Defendant appeared by video from the Jackson County Jail.  Attorney Fredrickson appeared in court.  Waive reading of the complaint.  Defendant stood mute.  NGP entered by the court.  Set for plea/sentencing 2/8/16 at 10 am.  Set other case that day also.
Defendant appeared by video from the Jackson County Jail.

ADA Melissa Inlow appears for the State.  Defendnat appeared by video from the Jackson County Jail.  No counsel present.  Court recited the charge and possible penalties contained in the complaint.  He understood.  Court advised the defendant of his representation options.  Defendant says Attorney Fredrickson represents him.  Adjourn to 3:00 today with his other case.
